natural problem:
Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix}.\]
natural solution: We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} &= (y + 1)\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} - y \begin{vmatrix} y & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} y & y + 1 \\ y & y \end{vmatrix} \\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes y :: real and A :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i j. A $ i $ j = (if i = j then y + 1 else y)"
shows  "det A = 3 * y + 1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 3y + 1
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} &= (y + 1)\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} - y \begin{vmatrix} y & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} y & y + 1 \\ y & y \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= (y + 1)((y + 1)(y + 1) - y^2) - y(y(y + 1) - y^2) + y(y^2 - y(y + 1)) \\ &= \boxed{3y + 1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes y :: real and A :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i j. A $ i $ j = (if i = j then y + 1 else y)"
shows  "det A = 3 * y + 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the determinant of a 3x3 matrix $A$ where each diagonal entry is $y+1$ and each off-diagonal entry is $y$. The final answer is $3y+1$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i j. M $ i $ j = (if i = j then y + 1 else y)"
shows  "det M = 3*y + 1"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 3y + 1
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} &= (y + 1)\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} - y \begin{vmatrix} y & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} y & y + 1 \\ y & y \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= (y + 1)((y + 1)(y + 1) - y^2) - y(y(y + 1) - y^2) + y(y^2 - y(y + 1)) \\ &= \boxed{3y + 1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i j. M $ i $ j = (if i = j then y + 1 else y)"
shows  "det M = 3*y + 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the determinant of a 3x3 matrix M, where each diagonal element is $y+1$ and each off-diagonal element is $y$. The final answer is $3*y + 1$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = matrix([[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]])"
shows  "det M = 3 * y + 1"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 3y + 1
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} &= (y + 1)\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} - y \begin{vmatrix} y & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} y & y + 1 \\ y & y \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= (y + 1)((y + 1)(y + 1) - y^2) - y(y(y + 1) - y^2) + y(y^2 - y(y + 1)) \\ &= \boxed{3y + 1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = matrix([[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]])"
shows  "det M = 3 * y + 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Find the determinant of the 3x3 matrix $M = \begin{bmatrix} y+1 & y & y \\ y & y+1 & y \\ y & y & y+1 \end{bmatrix}$. The final answer is $3y + 1$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes y :: real
assumes h0 : "let M = [[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]] in det M = 3 * y + 1"
shows  "det [[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]] = 3 * y + 1"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 3y + 1
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} &= (y + 1)\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} - y \begin{vmatrix} y & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} y & y + 1 \\ y & y \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= (y + 1)((y + 1)(y + 1) - y^2) - y(y(y + 1) - y^2) + y(y^2 - y(y + 1)) \\ &= \boxed{3y + 1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes y :: real
assumes h0 : "let M = [[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]] in det M = 3 * y + 1"
shows  "det [[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]] = 3 * y + 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem:
Find the determinant of the 3x3 matrix given by 

[[y + 1, y, y], 
 [y, y + 1, y], 
 [y, y, y + 1]] 

The determinant is said to be equal to 3*y + 1.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = matrix ([[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]])"
shows  "det M = 3 * y + 1"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 3y + 1
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y & y \\ y & y + 1 & y \\ y & y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} &= (y + 1)\begin{vmatrix} y + 1 & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} - y \begin{vmatrix} y & y \\ y & y + 1 \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} y & y + 1 \\ y & y \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= (y + 1)((y + 1)(y + 1) - y^2) - y(y(y + 1) - y^2) + y(y^2 - y(y + 1)) \\ &= \boxed{3y + 1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = matrix ([[y + 1, y, y], [y, y + 1, y], [y, y, y + 1]])"
shows  "det M = 3 * y + 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Find the determinant of a 3x3 matrix where each row consists of two elements equal to a given real number, $y$, and one element equal to $y+1$. The elements $y+1$ are placed on the main diagonal, running from the top left to the bottom right of the matrix. The determinant of this matrix is $3y + 1$.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = (\<chi> i j. if i = j then y + 1 else y)"
shows  "det M = 3 * y + 1"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate

 &= (y + 1)((y + 1)(y + 1) - y^2) - y(y(y + 1) - y^2) + y(y^2 - y(y + 1)) \\ &= \boxed{3y + 1}. \end{align}
 *)

fixes y :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = (\<chi> i j. if i = j then y + 1 else y)"
shows  "det M = 3 * y + 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
